definitions.sensetop: surround something/somebodybe surrounded by somethingbe surrounded with something

examples.text: The garden is surrounded by a wall.
As a child I was surrounded by love and kindness.
I loved being **surrounded by** enthusiastic young **people**.
The lake is surrounded with trees.

definitions.definition: to move into position all around somebody/something, especially so as to prevent them from escaping; to move somebody/something into position in this way

examples.text: They've surrounded the building with police.
Will found himself immediately surrounded by screaming fans.
On one occasion, armed guerrillas surrounded their jeep.
Troops fanned out to surround the camp.
He has now surrounded his house with barbed wire.

definitions.definition: to be closely connected with something/somebody

examples.text: The report explores the issues surrounding the case.

definitions.definition: to choose to have particular people or things near you all the time

examples.text: I like to surround myself with beautiful things.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘overflow’): from Old French souronder, from late Latin superundare, from super- ‘over’ + undare ‘to flow’ (from unda ‘a wave’); later associated with round. The current noun sense dates from the late 19th cent.
